alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 23 at 12:06PM AKST until November 24 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Prince of Wales, Southern Inner Channels and Central Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Petersburg, Kake, Port Alexander, Craig, Klawock, Hydaburg, Coffman Cove, Thorne Bay, Wrangell, Ketchikan, And Metlakatla. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong and moist weather system will continue moving over the area today, producing 2 to 3.5 inches of rain with localized higher amounts. Heaviest rain rates will be Wednesday afternoon. Rivers and streams are already high from previous rainfall and small streams may rise quickly to or exceed bankful levels. The potential for flooding may persist into Thursday if the heavy rainfall lasts longer.
info.instruction: Residents should monitor forecast updates and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
